intro: Micractis drosocephala, commonly known as the drosocephala sea anemone, is a species of cnidarian found in marine environments. It belongs to the family Actiniidae and is characterized by its relatively small size and delicate, translucent body. The polyp has a short, bluntly tapered column with a crown of tentacles surrounding its oral disc. It typically inhabits shallow coastal waters and is often found attached to substrates such as rocks or coral. This species plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various small organisms.
